title: Unicode headers produce invalid anchors
body:
When redcarpet processes Unicode headers to produce anchors (for use in TOC generation) it returns invalid anchors. The anchor claims to be in UTF-8, but it contains hexadecimal codes. Worse, the hexadecimal codes are not valid. For example, it returns `\xE3\xA9` instead of `\xC3\xA9` for an é. I suspect that what is happening is that the string has been incorrectly converted to lowercase, changing \xc3 to \xe3. The lowercase conversion has assumed latin1 encoding when it was actually utf-8. (HT : [Janne Karila](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14852224/unicode-latin1-string-encode-decode) Example : `irb(main):001:0> require 'redcarpet'` `=> true` `irb(main):002:0> markdown = Redcarpet::Markdown.new(Redcarpet::Render::HTML_TOC)` `=> #>` `irb(main):003:0> test = "# Précis"` `=> "# Précis"` `irb(main):004:0> rc = markdown.render(test)` `=> "
    \n
  • \nPrécis\n
    • \n
\n"` `irb(main):005:0> test.encoding` `=> #` `irb(main):006:0> rc.encoding` `=> #` `irb(main):007:0> puts "pr\xC3\xA9cis"` `précis` `=> nil`

title: Definition lists
body:
Could you implement definition lists, please?

Here is some examples taken from other markdown dialects:
* [Markdown Extra](https://michelf.ca/projects/php-markdown/extra/#def-list)
* [Kramdown and Maruku](http://kramdown.gettalong.org/syntax.html#definition-lists)
* [MultiMarkdown](https://github.com/fletcher/MultiMarkdown/wiki/MultiMarkdown-Syntax-Guide#definition-lists)
* [Pandoc](http://pandoc.org/demo/example9/pandocs-markdown.html#definition-lists)
* [Python Markdown](http://pythonhosted.org/Markdown/extensions/definition_lists.html)
* [Lunamark](http://jgm.github.io/lunamark/lunamark.1.html)

Thank you!

title: Multiline tables
body:
Could you implement something similar to [Pandoc multiline tables](http://pandoc.org/README.html#tables), please?

Thank you!

title: Unable to compile native extensions in OS X "El Capitan"
body:
Hi! I got the following output when I tried to `gem install redcarpet -v '3.3.3'` on my macbook running OS X 10.11.

```
/usr/local/opt/rbenv/versions/2.1.5/bin/ruby extconf.rb
creating Makefile

make "DESTDIR=" clean

make "DESTDIR="
compiling autolink.c
compiling buffer.c
buffer.c:110:45: warning: passing 'const struct buf *' to parameter of type 'struct buf *' discards qualifiers [-Wincompatible-pointer-types-discards-qualifiers]
        if (buf->size + 1 <= buf->asize || bufgrow(buf, buf->size + 1) == BUF_OK) {
                                                   ^~~
buffer.c:59:21: note: passing argument to parameter 'buf' here
bufgrow(struct buf *buf, size_t neosz)
                    ^
1 warning generated.
compiling houdini_href_e.c
compiling houdini_html_e.c
compiling html.c
compiling html_smartypants.c
compiling markdown.c
markdown.c:2838:43: warning: passing 'const uint8_t *' (aka 'const unsigned char *') to parameter of type 'uint8_t *' (aka 'unsigned char *') discards qualifiers [-Wincompatible-pointer-types-discards-qualifiers]
                if (codefences_enabled && (is_codefence(document + beg, doc_size - beg, NULL) != 0))
                                                        ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~
markdown.c:1391:23: note: passing argument to parameter 'data' here
is_codefence(uint8_t *data, size_t size, struct buf *syntax)
                      ^
1 warning generated.
compiling rc_markdown.c
compiling rc_render.c
compiling stack.c
linking shared-object redcarpet.bundle
ld: library not found for -lgmp
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
make: *** [redcarpet.bundle] Error 1

make failed, exit code 2
```

In particular, the line `ld: library not found for -lgmp` seemed odd to me. I didn't think that GMP was a dependency, so I poked around in the `ext/` directory and discovered that extconf added `-lgmp` to my cflags for some reason even though it's not mentioned in `extconf.rb` or anywhere.... Now that I've written this much, is this maybe an extconf bug? Not sure. I've already written this much already so....

title: tables not rendered despite option
body:
With ruby-2.2.3 and redcarpet 3.3.2 tables aren't rendered despite having turned on the option. What am I doing wrong? ```ruby Redcarpet::Markdown.new(Redcarpet::Render::HTML, tables: true).render("| --- | ---|\n| ex | ample |") => "

| --- | ---|\n| ex | ample |

\n" ```

title: Fix memory leak in Redcarpet::Render::Base
body:
`rb_redcarpet_rbase_alloc` used to allocate a `struct rb_redcarpet_rndr` instance
which was never freed.

This caused 312 leaked bytes (on a 64-bit machine) on every render call!

title: Ruby crashing
body: I've found a serious issue, causing the ruby interpreter to crash. There might be a problem with the native extensions you are building.

body:
Can someone help fix those?
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=797101

title: Lists rendered incorrectly
body:
For some reason, redcarpet is not rendering lists correctly, when there is a new line in between list items. Instead of going 1, 2, etc., redcarpet displays the list as 1, 1, etc.

Is there anyway to fix this without having to remove the lines between list items?

**Please note that Github displays the markdown correctly (without the bug I am seeing).**

---

**Context / Important Stuff:**

*Parsing Strategy:*
```ruby
redcarpet = Redcarpet::Markdown.new(CustomHtml.new(hard_wrap: true), tables: true, no_intra_emphasis: true, fenced_code_blocks: true, lax_spacing: true)
```
and
```ruby
rendered_markdown = redcarpet.render(markdown)
```

*Markdown to be Parsed:*
```
1. blahblah

* blah

2. blahblah
```

title: Special case word boundaries for fractions
body: special handling for 1/4/2000 in smartypants

title: smartypants incorrectly handling fractions correctly
body:
why all the hate for the 1 of April :smile: 

```
[11] pry(main)> Redcarpet::Render::SmartyPants.render("1/4 a year ago on 1/4/2010 something happened")
=> "¼ a year ago on ¼/2010 something happened"
```

should be 

```
=> "¼ a year ago on 1/4/2010 something happened"
```

there should be a bypass if the char after the fraction is `/` which is punctuation but not in that context

title: Question: Wrap Headline and its Paragraph in p-Tag
body:
Hi, I need to wrap all headlines and their paragraphs in a `

`-Tag. Any idea how to implement that? Example: ```md # 1. Headline Level 1 This is some Text ## 1.1 Headline Level 2 This is even more Text # 2. Another Headline Level 1 And this is text too ``` Should be parsed to: ```html

1. Headline Level 1

This is some Text

1.1 Headline Level 2

This is even more Text

2. Another Headline Level 1

And this is text too

``` Thank you for any advice in advance

title: Fix the COPYING content to be MIT
body:
The license in .gemspec says it is MIT and the associated ticket (#246) as well, but the content of the COPYING file is ISC license [1]. Could you please update the file to be MIT [2]. Thanks.



[1] http://www.isc.org/downloads/software-support-policy/isc-license/
[2] http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT

title: Anchor syntax issues?
body:
I can't find a solution to this online, but I may have a syntax issue between Markdown parsers. For example, if I have: ``` ### [Getting Started](#getting_started) ## [Getting Started](id:getting_started) ``` I expect this code output from Redcarpet: ```html

Getting Started

``` ```html

Getting Started

``` But instead I get this: ```html

Getting Started

Getting Started

``` Is this correct behavior? Note that I have been using [Mou](http://25.io/mou/) for my previous markdown->HTML needs, and the guide in Mou says this is proper Markdown syntax: ![screen shot 2015-07-07 at 3 23 08 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5595293/8556348/1e95e8e6-24bc-11e5-822d-4f2380332de9.png) I'm using the git master branch for this. Any help would be appreciated!

title: Parsing bullet with indent with 2 spaces at least to follow commonmark
body:
Follow to http://spec.commonmark.org/0.17/#example-192

In redcarpet need 4 spaces to create indent block.

I know redcarpet exists before commonmark but majar diffrence from commonmark is this one. Can you add options to parse spaces in bullet?

Example

```
- a
  - b
```

and

```
- a
    - b
```

become same output

title: Seg fault when trying to render TOC
body:
I was doing some benchmarks and I keep getting segfaulted when doing HTML_TOC rendering

Here's my benchmark code:
```ruby 
require 'benchmark/ips'
require 'redcarpet.so'

TESTMD = File.read("./markdown_test_data.md") # from https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet

# Warmups
Redcarpet::Markdown.new(Redcarpet::Render::HTML.new).render(TESTMD)
Redcarpet::Markdown.new(Redcarpet::Render::HTML_TOC.new).render(TESTMD)

Benchmark.ips do |x|
  x.report 'standard-redcarpet' do
    Redcarpet::Markdown.new(Redcarpet::Render::HTML.new).render(TESTMD)
  end

  x.report 'standard-redcarpet-toc' do
    Redcarpet::Markdown.new(Redcarpet::Render::HTML_TOC.new).render(TESTMD)
  end
end

```
